Name: Lemon Herb Grilled Salmon
Steps: In a bowl, combine lemon zest, lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, dill, and parsley.
Season the salmon fillets with salt and black pepper. Place them in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over them. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Let the salmon rest for a few minutes before serving.

Name: Eggplant and Chickpea Curry
Steps: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the curry powder, cumin, and coriander. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the cubed eggplant and chickpeas. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 10-15 minutes, or until eggplant is tender.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve over cooked rice, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

Name: Balsamic Glazed Chicken
Steps: In a bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, and minced garlic.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Pour the balsamic glaze over the chicken during the last minute of cooking, allowing it to thicken slightly.
Serve hot.

Name: Thai Green Curry with Tofu
Ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, snow peas, carrots)
1 tablespoon fish sauce (optional, for non-vegetarian version)
Steps: Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the green curry paste and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add the cubed tofu, mixed vegetables, fish sauce (if using), and brown sugar. Cook for 10-15 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and tofu is heated through.
Serve over cooked jasmine rice, garnished with fresh basil leaves.

Name: Creamy Spinach and Mushroom Pasta
Steps: Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes, until browned.
Stir in the fresh spinach and minced garlic. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until spinach is wilted.
Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Toss the cooked pasta with the creamy spinach and mushroom sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
Ingredients: 400g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 green bell pepper, cut into chunks
1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
Steps: Coat the chicken pieces in cornstarch.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the coated chicken and cook for about 5 minutes, or until golden and cooked through.
Add the bell peppers and pineapple chunks. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until vegetables are slightly tender.
Pour the sweet and sour sauce over the chicken and vegetables. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring to coat everything evenly.
Serve over cooked rice.

Name: Vegetarian Chili
Ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) black beans, drained and rinsed
Steps: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, garlic, bell pepper, zucchini, and corn. Cook for about 5 minutes, or until vegetables are softened.
Stir in the black beans, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Let the chili simmer for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve hot, garnished with diced avocado, fresh cilantro leaves, and a dollop of sour cream if desired.

Name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
Steps: Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until pink and cooked through. Season with salt and black pepper.
Stir in the lemon zest and juice. Cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Toss the cooked pasta with the lemon garlic shrimp and grated Parmesan cheese.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
Steps: In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over high heat. Add the thinly sliced onion and cook for 2-3 minutes, until slightly softened.
Add the bell pepper, carrot, zucchini, broccoli, and snap peas. Stir-fry for about 5 minutes, or until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Pour in the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and hoisin sauce. Toss to coat the vegetables evenly.
Serve the vegetable stir-fry over cooked rice.

Name: Mushroom Stroganoff
Steps: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes, until browned.
Add the finely chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the minced garlic and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Sprinkle the flour over the mushroom mixture and stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute.
Gradually pour in the vegetable broth and Worcestershire sauce, stirring constantly. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
Remove the skillet from heat and stir in the sour cream. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the mushroom stroganoff over cooked egg noodles, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Spaghetti Carbonara
Steps: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, cook the diced pancetta or guanciale over medium heat until crispy. Remove from heat and drain excess fat.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, minced garlic, and black pepper.
Toss the cooked spaghetti with the egg mixture, ensuring the residual heat cooks the eggs to a creamy consistency.
Stir in the crispy pancetta or guanciale.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Paneer Tikka Masala
Ingredients: Cooked rice or naan, for serving
Steps: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger garlic paste, garam masala, paprika, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and chili powder.
Add the paneer cubes to the marinade and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Thread the marinated paneer onto skewers and grill until lightly charred on all sides.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the tomato puree and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the grilled paneer and heavy cream. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until heated through.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve over cooked rice or with naan, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

Name: Lentil and Vegetable Curry
Ingredients: 1 cup green lentils, rinsed and drained
2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., carrots, peas, bell peppers)
Steps: In a large pot, combine green lentils and vegetable broth. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Stir in the curry powder, cumin, and coriander. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the mixed vegetables and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Pour in the coconut milk and cooked lentils (including any remaining broth). Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve over cooked rice, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

Name: Creamy Sun-Dried Tomato Chicken
Ingredients: 1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained and chopped
Steps: Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, cook the chicken breasts over medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the chopped sun-dried tomatoes and minced garlic. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream, grated Parmesan cheese, fresh basil, and fresh parsley. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until heated through.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and coat with the creamy sun-dried tomato sauce.
Serve hot.

Name: Tofu and Vegetable Stir-Fry
Steps: In a bowl, toss the cubed tofu with soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add the marinated tofu and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden.
Remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the thinly sliced onion and bell pepper. Stir-fry for about 3 minutes, or until slightly softened.
Add the broccoli florets, snow peas, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes, until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Return the cooked tofu to the skillet and toss to combine with the vegetables.
Serve the tofu and vegetable stir-fry over cooked rice.

Name: Cajun Shrimp and Sausage Skillet
Steps: Season the shrimp with Cajun seasoning.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced andouille sausage and cook for about 2 minutes per side, until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the chopped bell pepper and onion. Cook for about 3 minutes, until slightly softened.
Add the minced garlic and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Stir in the chicken broth and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Return the cooked sausage to the skillet. Add the seasoned shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until pink and cooked through.
Pour in the heavy cream and cook for another 2 minutes, until heated through.
Serve the Cajun shrimp and sausage over cooked rice, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Miso Glazed Eggplant
Steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Score the cut sides of the eggplant halves in a crisscross pattern.
In a bowl, whisk together miso paste, mirin, soy sauce, brown sugar, and sesame oil.
Brush the cut sides of the eggplants with the miso mixture.
Place the eggplants on a baking sheet, cut side up, and roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until tender and caramelized.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

Name: Chickpea and Spinach Curry
Steps: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Stir in the curry powder, cumin, coriander, and turmeric. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the chickpeas, chopped spinach, and coconut milk. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until spinach is wilted and chickpeas are heated through.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve over cooked rice, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

Name: Caprese Stuffed Chicken
Steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Make a pocket in each chicken breast by slicing horizontally, being careful not to cut all the way through.
Stuff each chicken breast with halved cherry tomatoes, diced mozzarella cheese, and chopped basil.
Season the outside of the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Add the stuffed chicken breasts and sear for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.

Name: Teriyaki Beef Stir-Fry
Steps: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, and brown sugar.
Add the thinly sliced beef to the marinade and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add the marinated beef and stir-fry for about 2 minutes, or until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add the thinly sliced onion and red bell pepper. Stir-fry for about 3 minutes, or until slightly softened.
Add the snap peas, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Return the cooked beef to the skillet and toss to combine with the vegetables.
Serve the teriyaki beef stir-fry over cooked rice, garnished with sesame seeds.

Name: Creamy Pesto Gnocchi
Steps: Cook the gnocchi in a large pot of boiling salted water until they float to the surface. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the pesto sauce over medium heat. Stir in the heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until heated through and slightly thickened.
Add the cooked gnocchi to the skillet and toss to coat with the creamy pesto sauce. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with halved cherry tomatoes and fresh basil leaves.

Name: Baked Ziti
Steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook the ziti pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and return to the pot.
Stir in the marinara sauce, ricotta cheese, and half of the mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and sprinkle the remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Name: Sesame Orange Chicken
Ingredients: 400g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
Steps: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, orange juice, honey, sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger.
Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water to make a slurry.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook for about 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
Pour in the cornstarch slurry and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
Serve the sesame orange chicken over cooked rice, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

Name: Mushroom and Spinach Risotto
Steps: In a separate saucepan, heat the vegetable broth over low heat.
In a large skillet or saucepan, melt the butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add the finely chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in the minced garlic and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.

Gradually add the heated vegetable broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly and allowing the liquid to be absorbed before adding more. Continue this process until the rice is creamy and cooked al dente, about 18-20 minutes.
While the rice is cooking, sauté the sliced mushrooms in a separate skillet until browned. Set aside.
Stir the sautéed mushrooms and fresh spinach leaves into the risotto until the spinach is wilted.
Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Chana Masala
Ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
Cooked rice or naan, for serving
Steps: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the finely chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Stir in the cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the drained chickpeas, diced tomatoes, and water. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve over cooked rice or with naan, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.
